content:
If prices are per 1k tokens, then you pay the price of a 1000 tokens regardless if youre under 1000 tokens.

You will get charged Math.ceil(tokens/1000)*price
Not tokens * price / 1000

Also confirmed by ChatGPT itself:
"So, if you input 100 tokens:

You won't be charged for exactly 100 tokens. Instead, OpenAI will round up to the nearest thousand tokens (which is 1000 in this case) and then calculate the cost based on that."

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I had a go at this clash of code. This is great, I like it

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: May be hard to code in less than 5 minutes

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Great clash, not too simple but should be solvable by all levels of clashers within 15 minutes.

Statement:
66,66666666667 is confusing, I'd suggest just saying instead that "1.5 tokens is one word". You also use a comma here but you use "." as the decimal separator elsewhere and a comma as the thousands separator earlier in the sentence "per 1,000 tokens".
You seem to round to 4 decimal places, but you never mention this in the here or the Output section.

Output:
You seem to round to 4 decimal places, but you never mention this in the statement or here.
"invalid Model" is an abnormal capitalisation of words, I'd suggest "Invalid Model".

Tests:
You re-use the same msg across multiple tests, it would be best to use new ones, but you can keep each pair of test+validator similar like 5DN1L said, just have new messages as the pairs progress.

Overall:
It's a good clash. Once these issues are fixed I will approve. :)

Output
* Please format "Money needed" as a [[variable]] instead of a {{constant}}.

Cases
* Please change the cases so that each pair of test and validator is similar but not the same.

Thanks.
Thank you for the feedback! Done

Thank you very much for your feedback! 
I have incorporated the suggestions you made and also added two new tests.  I kept the same messages in example 1 and 2 to show the difference between the model inputs. 
I also varied the messages overall.

As for the capitalization and decimal separator, as a German I'm not that used to it, so thanks for pointing that out :D

Thank you. Still some more fixes are needed:

Output
* Please format "$" as a constant as you original did.

Cases
* Please vary the messages so that the output (money needed) is not the same for each of the first three pairs of cases.

Thanks.

Yes that is a good point. My first thought was that this clarifies the relevance of the word count.

Done.
